author: Joaglolo
title: Not being listened to
body:
I was admitted to hospital with severe sudden neck pain and head pain. I was admitted to short stay in RVH. On admission and arriving it took approx 1 hour for any staff member to come near me. Staff were standing around chatting. Over the few days and on numerous occasions I pleaded with staff whilst in distress to listen to me and no one did. I was advised that the doctor had left for the day, or that they would need to call the on call doctor, or was asked whyI hadn't said things when then the doctor was there.  
I was gradually getting worse and I was just given strong analgesia that made me sleep. On one particular day two days after my admission I cried and broke down to staff that something was not right. I was in extreme pain and again not being listened to. I pleaded whilst so distressed in pain to get a scan of my neck as the pain was so intense. I was given more analgesia and told the doctor will be around shortly.  
I was getting numbness and weakness down one side of my body from my face to my arm and hand and a severe headache. The on call doctor said it was my cannula that has tissued. I knew this was not the case. I asked for more analgesia and was told by the nurse that I already had some an hour ago and wasn’t due until 10pm. Come 11:30pm and the nurse still has not returned.  
The next day I pleaded with the consultant to scan my neck before the discharged me. As I had already had a head scan he said I would be exposed to too much radiation and could not do scan and that I was ok to go home. Despite the neck pain and numbness/weakness down one side of my body.  
6 days later I was readmitted to hospital and after another awful experience on a different ward I was given a diagnosis! A diagnosis that had I been listened too would have been picked up sooner.  
I am a health care professional myself and I am shocked at how unprofessional some of the staff were and how I was made to feel like a hindrance!  
A few staff of the staff were fantastic.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: tauruswh45
title: Went above and beyond to help my mum
body:
I just wanted to thank you for the help you gave to me and my mum recently. You have been an absolute godsend and your support has been invaluable. You went above and beyond to help my mum. It was you who contacted K about the possibility of medication to aid sleep and you also researched talking books. Both things have been implemented and have greatly improved mum’s life.  
We will never forget the help and kindness you showed us.

author: sambags68
title: Pleased with everything
body: Just to say the podiatry care received here at Park Medical was absolutely excellent. Staff are very good and I am pleased with everything. Have a further appointment in three months. Thank you.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: sculptoryf97
title: Nothing is to much trouble
body: The care I get is very very good and I am so thankful for the help and support. I have a carer come in the morning and she helps me with my breakfast, another comes in the evening and helps me to get undressed and prepares my supper. Another person comes during the week and does my light shopping, bread milk and so on. Don’t now what I would do without them. Brilliant they are, nothing is to much trouble.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: KevoG
title: Unresponsive service
body:
I was due a CT scan at Crawley hospital but due to extensive complex mental health issues I was too scared to leave the safety of my room to attend. I have a phobia of using phones (yes it's a real thing it's called Telephobia) and due to being in mental health crisis at the time I asked my Dad if he would phone on my behalf to cancel. He was told the patient is the only one who can cancel so it will go down as a missed appointment.  
Yet again the NHS provides absolutely no facilities for those who have mental health illnesses. I find that the NHS has very little sympathy for mental health issues and look on it as a burden to them. We are in the 21st century, 2022, man has stepped on the Moon but the NHS can't provide an email service or similar for those with mental health issues.  
I sincerely hope I don't get a letter telling me I have missed my appointment and cost the NHS "X" number of pounds. Why can't a marker be put on a patient's medical records to show they are vulnerable and need extra help or encouragement? I have this problem time and time again, I have missed several appointments to due agoraphobia and post ICU PTSD, I get treated with suspicion and contempt constantly from receptionists who don't understand at all and more than likely don't care.

author: Reabx64
title: I have a new lease of life
body:
I just wanted to say I am forever Thankful to Ellen and her team at Lincoln County hospital Gynaecology Department. I received an abnormal Smear result back in January and was extremely anxious as a result.  
I was thinking the worst case scenario and it was very difficult to stay positive. I was sent for a Colposcopy. At the appointment Ellen and the two other staff members were so lovely; they were conversational and upbeat and really, really put me at ease. They explained the procedure beforehand and throughout and provided great aftercare information (both written and verbal).  
It turned out I had some pre cancerous cells in my Cervix and they carried out a 'Loop Excision Biopsy' to remove the cells and send off for a biopsy. Lots of hand squeezing was had during the procedure!  
I will forever be so so grateful to Ellen and her team, for routine Smear tests and the NHS we are so blessed with in this country. I now feel I have a new lease of life and can live without fear. :-) :-)

author: mayzk79
title: Big relief
body: I wanted to give my opinion on the care package we receive for my husband as I think it has made an awful big difference for me. Carers come in and help me four times a day and they are so lovely, kind, compassionate and caring. They are very professional and offer support to me as well as my husband. My husband is now bedbound after a fracture but also has osteoporosis and COPD. The help from them is a big relief and weight off my mind and I just do not know how I could manage without them. So grateful for how we are looked after.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: cruxke56
title: Absolutely fantastic people
body:
My husband has Parkinson’s and the carers come in the morning to see to his needs, help him wash dress etc. I have recently been in hospital for a hip replacement and without having to ask they put in an extra care package and support for us. My husband is bedbound now, so they arranged for a physiotherapist to come out and visit us, the support we get is absolutely fantastic.  
We also get help from the Arches Wellbeing Centre; they are really obliging. We are having a really bad time, but these people care so much they are such nice people and they deserve a medal. We don’t have to ask them, they seem to know what we need, they are so friendly that we look forward to their visits. They are angels.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Copydex
title: Multiple rib fractures after being kicked by my horse
body:
Family member drove me the 13 miles to NDDH A&E where I was promptly seen at reception. I took a seat in the waiting room and was seen by a triage doctor after about 15 mins. Given the mechanism of injury - large shod horse fly kicking me to the side of my chest I had a chest X-ray and moved to a side room. The staff were very attentive and pain relief given. There was a delay in getting a CT scan but after being chased I had the scan.  
The doctor confirmed numerous rib fractures and that some were displaced puncturing my lung. The doctor was unable to speak directly with the thoracic specialist in Derriford but emailed all the details as it was shift change over (6pm). After a wait Derriford replied that I required surgery and would be transferred to Plymouth. I remained in a side cubicle until a bed was found and I could be admitted to NDDH for the night.  
The staff in A&E were excellent and made me as comfortable as possible. Appropriate scans and consultation was done for a clear treatment plan. I was assured and felt that the staff were doing all they could.  
I was admitted onto the ward where again staff were attentive and made me as comfortable to possible. The ward was full but I felt I could ask for assistance if I required it. Appropriate pain relief was given. Bed was comfortable and food ok.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: mwc23
title: Multiple cancelled planned knee replacement surgeries
body:
I appreciate at the moment we are all living with the effects of COVID 19 especially our NHS. This said I believe that 3 planned knee surgery cancellations is extreme.  
It began back in 2020 when I had my first pre-op assessment appointment date in March at University hospital Monklands, Rightly so given the circumstances back then my appointment was cancelled by telephone and I was informed they would be in touch ASAP with a re-scheduled appointment.  
In July 2021 I received a letter informing me I had now been passed to another surgeons list at Hairmyres hospital. Following on from that I received a call from the orthopaedic theatre scheduler offering me a surgery date at the end of July 2021. A letter was sent to me to confirm this and also a date for a pre-op assessment mid July, followed which I attended at Hairmyres Hospital. I also had an appointment at the Monklands hospital for a covid swab to be done and asked to isolate from then to my admission date. During my isolating period I received a call on from theOrthopaedic Theatre Scheduler cancelling my procedure and they would be in contact when another date became available.  
In August I received another call form Orthopaedic Theatre Scheduler to offer me a new date for surgery, which I again accepted. No pre-op assessment was required this time. I was sent a date for a Covid swab again at Monklands Hospital and begun my isolation period. Two days from my surgery date I was contacted again to cancel my operation as no non emergency surgical procedures were taking place due to Covid and that I would be contacted again when things changed.  
Moving forward there had been no contact from the hospital of any updates, so I contacted the hospital myself in February 2022 and after a few phone calls the Orthopaedic Theatre Scheduler contacted me and informed me that surgical procedures were taking place again. I received another call on at the end of February 2022 offering me a surgery date of which I again accepted. I then received a call to change my admission time to 11am. Numerous appointments followed the next week:  
Telephone Pre-op assessment 9.30am  
Bloods/swabs etc Hairmyres Hospital 11.00am  
Echo Scan 10.30am surgeon clinic appointment 11.30am Hairmyres  
Covid Swab Monkland hospital 2.20pm  
Followed isolating procedures ready for my surgery on the Monday  
On the day of my planned surgery at 9.20am I received a call from my surgeon to inform that my surgery was cancelled once again due to staff isolating.  
Not only has this had a huge impact on my physical health but also my mental health each time preparing myself for surgery to be let down last minute.  
There has also been an impact on my work as I work in a childcare setting there has to be provisions made to allow me to leave to attend appointments etc, parents consultations cancelled and re-scheduled, outside agency meeting changed numerous times, There are some aspects of my role at present I cannot carry out, there are plans in place to support me with this also impacting on my close working colleagues. Supply staff put in place to cover my absence to then be told they are no longer required. Time off for isolating periods 3 times with still no end result.  
I fully appreciate that the NHS are under pressure but I am extremely frustrated and upset by all of this. We have been living with COVID for almost 2 years now and don't understand why there are no plans in place to deal with staff shortages due to COVID.

author: indiaqw35
title: Can't do enough for you
body:
I was discharged from hospital yesterday and given a card to let you know how it went. I had surgery and the service I received was second to none. The staff were so helpful it was unbelievable. Everything was explained so well and I felt very comfortable. Nothing was too much bother for them.  
I would like to thank the surgeon, the night sister – indeed all the staff are very helpful and couldn’t do enough for you.  
I was given my discharge notes and I have a review with my surgeon in 4 weeks.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: KayC
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My Reiki experience
body:
It has been very beneficial, particularly if I have had a bad week or am feeling agitated, relieving stress.  
My whole being is much better and I leave feeling calmer.  
It totally takes me out of myself for that hour.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Jellybean71
title: Amazing paramedic care
body:
I recently dislocated and fractured my ankle. I really had to feedback about the care of the paramedics who came to my assistance. They were amazing in every sense. Not only did they assess and quickly take action to treat me in a professional and friendly manner. It was the way they interacted with me that made all the difference.  
At every stage they informed me what they were doing, what was happening and when giving me pain killers to try to relocate my ankle, explained everything I may feel. Although in pain it helped keep me calm and totally believe that I was in such safe hands. Which I was. I think great care goes beyond just treating the problem but treating the person.  
Thank you to Martin and Paul for your marvellous care.  
Equally the staff at Treliske were great. The Orthopaedic surgeon again explained and showed me my injuries, and informed me of what was going to happen. I am happy to provide a much more in depth story if any department would like.

readBy.name: South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

author: Sueeq79
title: Pancake Day around the world!
body: Kaim Court celebrated Pancake Day by making different types of pancakes from other places around the world. There were even a few friendly arguments about where the best came from! We had pancakes in all different shapes and sizes, made from recipes we all remembered from our childhood.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

body: 10/10. Another day I saw Dr, very good they explained everything. Appointments have been seen on time. I had booked an appointment using the link and will use the app definitely again

author: Abicy76
title: Wellbeing service
body: I felt constantly worried and the anxiety was all I could think about, as if every day something bad was going to happen, and this made me even more anxious.

title: Long wait on phone
body: I put information a repeat prescription on 25 February, and went to Boots to pick them up on 5th March,no prescription  received by them.Today I phoned the surgery as my husband was out of tablets.After being no 6 in the queue I waited 90 minutes and then decided to drive to the surgery.Half way there my call was answered,I was told the prescription  was sent to Central in Cliftonville.We didn't change the surgery as we had used Boots for over 30 years.The only time we used Central was to get some antibiotics prescribed by the hospital on a Sunday early evening,this was because we couldn't  get an appointment at the doctors and the e consult isn't  working. My stress levels are through the roof at the moment.

title: 3rd in queue and waited over an hour.
body:
Terrible experience trying to book an appointment was 3rd in the queue for over an hour, couldnt book an appointment for a future date told to call back tomorrow at 8am how long would i wait when i am on my way to work?
NHS app you cant book an appointment with the surgery told to go on econsult and wait to be called at anytime no slots which is impossible if you work . I just give up, feel for the the elderly they would not bother with anything online. Appalling.

title: DIDN'T WANT TO TREAT ME AS IT WASN'T MY HEALTH…
body: As I'm not from Lancaster and was on holiday here it was suggested that I go to my home town of Bolton rather than get treated here ?? I arrived at A&E and was happy with the wait time displayed on the live information board outside then once Inside it was 2hrs ( that was fine too) then I booked in and it was noticed I wasn't living in Lancaster and so the receptionist said it's 3hrs wait. Then a nurse sat next to her suggested going home as it's now 7hrs wait ??? The waiting area wasn't that busy. So I left and we drove home. I had a fractured hand and finger and quite a deep cut on my wrist and finger. I was treated by my own Health Authority so now Lancaster won't have to claim any money back. Totally unacceptable really, we pay our taxes surely one would be able to be treated at any NHS hospital. Nobody even looked at my injuries after falling with a glass that smashed in my hand, I hope next time I'm at my caravan I don't need any really urgent care from Lancaster NHS

title: Disgusting service
body: I have been getting the same tablets on repeat prescription for over 6 years, 2 years of which has been with this practice. An antidepressant and an antipsychotic. About 7 months ago they decided they were going to remove these tablets from my repeat without informing me. For a month the only way I could get my tablets was through 111 who treat you like you are a drug addict and make you out to be a liar because in no way could it have been the surgery's mistake. After over a month of sporadic tablets I became suicidal. I called the surgery and was seen the same day, but not by a doctor or nurse. I explained that my current mental state is due to my lack of tablets and was told that I need to work less and come back in 2 months if I feel the same. Again I was told that I couldn't have my tablets as they were not prescribed by that surgery, even though I had been getting them there for 2 years! Finally I managed to speak with a new doctor who was extremely helpful and over the next 5 months we both worked hard and managed to get me out of the situation I was in. I am finally able to get back to work full time only to go and pick up my prescription yesterday and be told that I couldn't have them as they were not prescribed by one of their GP's. After calling through about 50 times this morning I finally got through to the prescription line to be told that my tablet request was only put in yesterday so I need to wait for the doctor to review them. Complete and utter lies as it was put in a week ago, well within their 2 working day timescale. It is not right that people are this incompetent and lazy at their work when they are dealing with people lives. Getting my tablets on time may mean nothing to Conisbrough Group Practice but it does to me, which is why I make sure that I put my prescription request in with adequate time every month. Not that it makes a difference as they will just gaslight you into questioning your own sanity. You can only try and help yourself so much, and unfortunately I am in a position that I need help from a healthcare professional. Something which I have had to practically beg for and was only seen once I reached rock bottom, and not even by a doctor. And the receptionists are the ones that end up receiving the backlash from it because they are the ones on the front line so I think half the time they just don't answer the phone on purpose. I have stood outside that reception and watched a receptionist actively ignore my call, and we wonder why we can never get through. And the Doctors may as well be mythical creatures at this point for all the good they do, it is disgusting the complete and utter disregard they have for their patients health and wellbeing. They are meant to be there to help, not hinder!

author: Gahe
title: Lack of preparation for surgery
body:
On admission I was told that I would be awake for the surgery. I had not been informed of this and was not prepared for this experience. I found the experience of being numbed quite traumatic as I was numb right up to my chest. My blood pressure drop and I felt sick and panicked.  
It was 13 hours before I could get onto my feet and 5 days before I had the majority of feeling back in my leg. Even though I had been shown how to walk up stairs and walking on crutches I was given no further advice- i.e. how to lie in bed with a stapled knee safely.  
I found the 1st 3 days of being home quite harrowing at times. When home I felt that my crutches were too short for me (no-one measured me to see if the crutches were suitable). I am walking stooped over. I have had to borrow the next size up from a neighbour.

title: Accused of being a thief
body: After returning a blood pressure machine .I was unable to fill in the returning form as the staff could not find it.i then waited ages for an appointment as my readings were high. No response so I ended up booking a new appointment where I found out they had lost my readings. I was told by the nurse that I would have to do the procedure all again, but I hadn't returned the old machine so I would have to buy a new one. I did try to explain what had previously happened but she did not listen. I then went back to the receptionist who remembered I had returned the equipment.

author: decembercp59
title: Trying to contact the clinic
body: For two days now I have tried to contact the published number to make an appointment. It is impossible, just a message saying the line is busy and to try again later. When?

title: Cannot get appointment
body: Son had a lump on his testicle, other son had diabetes symptoms, no appointments available and now cannot get through on the phone. On hold for over 50 minutes. Need to start seeing patients.

title: Pathway failings
body: Supposed to be given an appointment for colonscopy under the 2 week cancer pathway. A contact call made but no appointment.  Loophole means no idea when appointment will take place.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent
body: The whole experience has been considerate, sympathetic and efficient. You can't ask more than that. Thanks

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body: I was looked after extremely well the service was fantastic and the support was amazing. Always felt comfortable and that everything was confidential.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust o

title: Great practice
body: I would just like to say thank you to the kind receptionist that was understanding and helped me get a GP to phone me back. Completely understood my situation and was so caring and compassionate

title: Excellent Practice
body: I would like to thank this wonderful Surgery for there kind and professional service I have encountered over the last 10 months of my Cancer diagnosis also being a T1 Diabetic from the Reception staff who have kindly reassured me they will contact me when they receive the letter from Christie’s with new Medication. To the GP’s I have seen with numerous Infections there kind and Professional manner in embarrassing situations meant a lot to me thank you. And to the Nurses who I have seen urgently over my Diabetes and when I was at a low point there words of kindness and reassurance was so kind thank you. Carry on with your excellent service in this difficult time thank you very much.

title: Awful.  What they do and what they say do not…
body:
I've had 2 x biopsy procedures at Wexham Park in the last year and on both occasions they wrote different things in my results letters to what I have been told. .

I was diagnosed with a condition that could give me and extremely high chance of developing cancer via letter. This contradicted what the consultant said the week previously via a telephone call. I called up and someone said (after several call attempts) they would correct this via letter. This never happened.

The second time (same procedure) I was told by the consultant that if the results came back "normal" then I would not need to repeat this procedure. My results can back as "normal" but the letter said I would need to repeat this procedure in 6 months.
I have been calling EVERY WEEK for the last 2 months for someone to contact me (via phone, via email and even via PALS x 4 times) for clarification on this contradiction but no one has bothered to call me back.  

So not only do I have incorrect information on my results letters but it seems that you all have fingers in your ears when I tell you they are incorrect.

I do not want apologies as they are hollow words from this hospital. I want to know why there is incorrect information being sent to patients (and letters will spelling and grammatical errors too) and why there is no SLA if a patient contacts a department for information.

AVOID!!!!!!!!!!

title: Absolutely outstanding care
body:
From ringing for an appointment and speaking to a lovely lady whom explained what would happen on arriving at the hospital to all the departments I visited on the 8th March 2022 I found absolutely wonderful.
I was very nervous and worried but from the fantastic lady who did my mammogram, the fantastic doctor and nurses who did my scans and the doctors and nurses who did my examination, I felt very safe and cared about. Everything was explained clearly throughout the whole experience, putting my worries at ease. 
The whole experience was run with such fantastic precision and organisation.
Finally, every staff member I met in each department was absolutely wonderful and I cannot thank them enough. Keep up the fantastic work you all do, I for one, really appreciate it.
A very grateful patient 
Elizabeth Lorraine Jones

title: Good Practice
body: I attended at 8:00am in the morning and asked for an urgent appointment at the practice as I really hadn't  been feeling very well, the receptionist was very compassionate and caring. She booked me in for an appointment with the GP and by 8.30am I had seen the GP and had a prescription. Thank you for this exceptionally efficient service.

title: Extremely skilled nurses
body: My leg after a gash in the lower left shin became ulcerated.. the treatment and care received from the lovely nurses in the Tuesday ulcer clinic was exemplary. They are skilled in the special training needed and thanks to them my leg is Ok.  Please pass on my thanks will you to the nurses.  Sheila birch

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Everything has been done efficiently and effectively
body: My knee has been giving me trouble after having an operation a few years ago, so yesterday I received an operation to resolve this. Everything has been done efficiently and effectively and I am hoping to get home today. I couldn't say a bad word about any of the staff- each and everyone of them you couldn't get better. The ward is spotless and the food is lovely. I don't see how anyone could ridicule such a fantastic ward. Thank you to all on orthopaedics.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very efficient practice, doctors and staff
body: Joined practice about 18 months back. There are 2 regular doctors and 2 regular locums. Very accommodative during the Pandemic. All the staff and doctors are courteous and caring. The practice has built up a good reputation as it is very efficient and the doctors fulfill their vocation. Appointments in person or face to face are easily available. Most of the services are provided in-house.

title: Experience has been excellent
body: I’ve only ever had an excellent experience with this surgery. I have always been given a quick appointment, the reception staff are always friendly and helpful, and the doctors I’ve met all have a really warm manner about them. They’ve been quick to diagnose my baby son a few times (and have helped to identify resolve something that could have amounted to something quite serious). A lovely new member of the reception staff allowed me a private space to breastfeed in, and the doctors always help me in with all my baby stuff (pram etc). I can’t fault them at all - a wonderful team.

author: TEllenB
title: More staff to look after patients post surgery
body:
The surgery itself was great, surgeon and anaesthesiologist wonderful, as was the nurse who accompanied me into surgery. The nurse who cared for me on the ward, however, I felt was severely lacking. She did not know what surgery I was having and had to ask me, rather than look at the records. In my opinion there was absolutely no aftercare provided. This was not the nursing staff's fault. I feel there needs to be more staff to look after patients post surgery.  
I arrived early in the morning and was only offered toast and coffee once post-surgery. No other food was offered or provided. I had to ask for water. Fortunately I was able to get up and around quicker than most of the other patients but those who could not, I felt were suffering.  
I had planned to stay overnight, as I had no one to look after me at home, but, since I felt there was virtually no oversight or monitoring provided, I figured I would be better off on my own. I did have a friend agree to look after me at home, but she could not stay all night.  
The ward was clean, but it took hours for them to collect my gown and other items, they remained on the floor for the bulk of my stay. Throughout my stay, there were very few signs of nursing staff on our floor. One lady was sick and had to deal with it on her own. Another needed to get back in bed but was left upright for the entire day. Again, no food was offered, for most of us on the ward that day.  
I know it is not the nursing staff's fault, they are expected to do too much and had no time. I think Tameside needs to provide more aftercare staff on that ward. It was appalling.

readBy.name: Tameside and Glossop Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor listening
body: After 3 hours at an Urgent Care Treatment centre we were sent to A&E by the Dr. Triage nurse refused to take the urine sample we had managed to get while waiting. Another 3 and a half hour wait to see a Dr in Children's A&E for them to tell me there wasn't anything wrong Wasn't vomiting (despite vomiting in the waiting room) and was only dehydrated with some blood in urine But nowt wrong- take them home!! Furious

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

author: corridorex83
title: I can’t praise the team highly enough
body: Attended for a CT scan today and from the minute I entered the unit I was treated fantastically well in a warm and professional manner which put me completely at ease. I can’t praise the team highly enough and this short message doesn’t do their work any justice at all. A massive thank you to everyone. Kind Regards

author: Nail
title: I can't thank the service enough
body: I came into Inclusions in October 2021 after hitting rock bottom through Alcohol dependency. I felt i had to get help for addiction as i could no longer do it on my own and i was in danger of losing everything. Inclusions have been amazing from start to finish and the groups that have been run have relay helped me on my journey. I used to think that things could be done for me, but if you put the work in life does improve. I am now 5 ,months sober , hold a service position within my local AA meeting group, i am hoping to volunteer in the future and i have found a new path to follow. Without such workers as Jarrod, Jason and Simon i am sure that my journey would have so much harder. I can't thank the service enough for giving me the tools i need to change things around.

author: passepartout
title: Lack of communication with the ward
body:
My mother became suddenly at the end of January, and was taken to hospital by ambulance in the early hours . The ambulance staff and the staff in the resus ward of A & E were all amazing. My mother was very seriously ill that morning with a possibility that she would die. Despite the pressures, the consultant in charge, Dr Martin, phoned me twice that morning, invited me to come up to see my mum and took time to speak to me in detail when I was there. My mother was admitted to Ward 5E later that day and I'm afraid that communication ever since has been far from great.  
I was only allowed to visit twice per week due to covid restrictions. This left us heavily reliant on phone calls to the ward for updates. My mum was often ill, confused and unable to keep in touch with us herself. Even when she did, she was unable to relay what was happening medically.  
My experience at the outset was of daily efforts to ring the ward. The phone was rarely answered. On some occasions it was answered and the person immediately hung up before any discussion could take place. On other occasions the person I spoke to had scant knowledge of my mother and her care. An update was to say that she was in good form that morning and having a cup of tea. On other occasions, when the phone goes unanswered, I have been put through to the patient liaison service who also have tried the ward without success. They have then put through a request for a call back.  
Both my sister and I have spent whole days waiting for callbacks which never materialised. I only get a meaningful update when I complain to patient liaison and ask that they note my complaint on the referral going to the ward. That shouldn't be necessary. The quality and accuracy of the information provided varies considerably. I have raised that directly which resulted in a detailed call from my mother's consultant who was very thorough and helpful.  
In late February I was contacted to advise that in person visiting was suspended for 14 days as a patient who had been discharged had tested positive for covid. I was told in that phone call about virtual visiting and that I would get daily updates. That did not happened. I believe I had two unprompted updates in the last week.  
In February I was contacted by one of the doctors on the ward at my mum's request. I was told that there was a discharge plan in place which required a care package. There was a detailed discussion with the doctor around the various medical issues and needs. At the end of that phone call I was able to speak to the OT, who also was helpful.  
Since then I have had no update about the care package, despite my mum telling every family member she speaks to that she is coming home tomorrow. We endlessly have to burst her bubble and tell her she isn't and that we have no information and no idea when anything will happen. I did receive an update at the end of February from the ward. I was again told there was no timescale for a care package. I asked for the name of the social worker who would be dealing with that, they were unable to give me that information. I managed to speak to the social worker eventually in early March to find out that my messages requesting a call from her had not been passed along from the ward to her.  
I phoned again in early March looking for an update. I was told that the nurse was doing meds so was too busy to come to the phone. I have no issue with that given that I rang at 9.30 and I understand the ward is busy at that time. I was told my mum was in good form etc. I said I was not satisfied with that as an update, that I wished to speak to someone about the care package and about when restrictions on visiting would be lifted and wanted a call back from someone who could answer those questions. No one called. I have placed another call this morning and am waiting again. I literally have to take my phone with me to the toilet in case the hospital call, because if I am not able to answer, they neither leave a message nor call back.  
This is a difficult situation made even more so by the lack of communication and the often poor quality of it at. With one exception, I would say that the quality of information provided by the doctors has been excellent When visiting, the nursing assistants have been great.. Unfortunately that is not my experience with some of the qualified nurses.  
We have been living with Covid for two years. I cannot imagine why a ward which deals with elderly people has been unable to put in place procedures for keeping family properly informed, given that many patients are very poorly and very confused. I and my family are simply exhausted with the effort of chasing the hospital.  
Last night my sister arrived for a visit at 6.00pm. She was met by a doctor explaining to our mother that they were moving her to Meadowlands in Musgrave Park Hopsital and were doing that right now. This was never raised as a possibility with us. It was not discussed with my mum , nor were we notified. I spoke to my mum later that evening, it was heartbreaking. She was confused, didn’t know where she was or why and was worried she would have nowhere to sleep the next day. This distress, upset and confusion were caused entirely by the appalling handling of this move. Had my sister not been there, we doubt that anyone would have informed us.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: lola2022
title: Exceptional Nursing Care
body:
My father was a patient in Ward 3C for approximately 3 weeks and the care he received was truly amazing. Despite staff shortages due to the pandemic all the staff took time to update us on how dad was responding to treatment and this was very reassuring for us as a family.  
We noticed at all times the nursing, ancillary and domestic staff were always cheery and welcoming to visitors and watching them interact with the patients in their care was heart warming.  
Unfortunately and unforeseen Dad took very unwell and we were advised that he was unlikely to survive. We had a harrowing 4 days of being constantly by his bedside watching him slip away. During this very difficult time the support we received as a family from the nurses and doctors was exceptional and we will forever be grateful for this.

author: volanszx74
title: Impressive care
body: I was called for a colonoscopy at Stafford Hospital following a per rectal bleed. The professionalism of the team in the colonoscopy suite was amazing. They found a lesion in my caecum which looked malignant and turned out to be cancer. How they handled this and cared for me after this finding was impressive. Thank you to Rachel and her team on that day in January 2022.

author: Mrssc66
title: The high standard of GP care delivered throughout the pandemic
body:
There have been various times throughout the pandemic where myself and my family required the care and support from our GP. Working within the NHS myself we have been subjected to many negative comments across the NHS in general around the care and support offered to families as well as many positive stories too. I want to focus on the positive care and support provided by the complete GP practice.  
The reception staff are always kind courteous and so helpful at our first point of contact. Phone consultations with our GP's have always been thorough, not rushed with all displaying an attitude of kindness, compassion and professionalism regardless of how busy they may be. These values are also displayed by their nursing teams. The opportunity for face to face consultation was also available when required. I cannot speak highly enough of the care we have all received during these unprecedented times and how highly our GP practice are thought of within our local community.

author: geminirn56
title: Eventually seen that night, nearly 10 hours after arriving
body:
I attended the Accident and Emergency Deptartment at Wishaw General with my mother, who is in her seventies in early March 2022. She was suffering from severe pain in her femur which she had had surgery on several months before and was unable to weight bear. We arrived at late morning, the department did looked fairly busy and at that point waiting times for Majors was 3hrs and Minors 2hrs.  
Monklands is our local hospital but given my mum had a femoral nailing in Wishaw in September on the area where she was suffering the pain, we attended there because of the orthopaedic service. My mum was triaged after approximately an hour and was told by the nurse that she would have been better attending Monklands and if she needed orthopaedic intervention she could have been referred. The nurse then said she would see if someone from orthopaedics would see her.  
After around 4 hrs of sitting in the waiting room, I asked reception staff if they had any idea as to how long we would have to wait to be seen by a Doctor and was abruptly told they couldn't give a time but there were 10 patients in front of her still to be seen.  
Another couple of hours passed and no orthopaedic Doctor appeared and she still waited to be seen by anyone. I asked on several occasions where my mum was in the queue and each time was never given a definite answer from the reception staff who in my view, overall weren't very pleasant.  
As we sat there that day I felt quite appalled at the overall treatment of patients. People sat in pain and although asked for pain relief, no one seemed to be in a hurry to help them, there was no communication with patients as to why they were waiting so long and the attitude of the reception staff was poor and they also spoke loudly and abrubtly for everyone in the waiting area to hear them. I felt the nurse who triaged my mum made no attempt to communicate what was happening with regards to the orthopaedic Doctor seeing her, also.  
My mum was eventually seen that night, nearly 10hrs after she arrived in the department. I understand that Accident and Emergency Departments are being stretched to their limits but how a 10hr wait can be seen to be acceptable, with zero communication or care given throughout this wait is appalling.

title: Terrible hospital
body: Waiting hour is approximately 4-5 hours in a&e. I would not recommend this hospital as they are very slow and always short on staff.

title: Oral and maxfax
body:
I have been on a waiting list over 3 years for my wisdom tooth taken out. At first i thought this delay may be due to covid restrictions, and dentists not doing much throughout the pandemic. However when i contacted the department i was told i had actually been taken off the list because the 2 lower ones have already been taken out (this is not the case). 

Got an appointment to attend for a covid swab on a Monday and then had to isolate until my procedure Thursday. This meant having to book 4 days off work and loose out on any income. To be rung Monday 5 hours before my covid swab appointment that they have both been cancelled due to no staff!! Was never asked if i want to rearrange it just that it was cancelled.

I will be attending Bassetlaw for this procedure now.
Thanks

readBy.name: Sarah Champion's Office, MP for Rotherham

author: eridanussj84
title: A waiting time of 10 hours is just totally unacceptable
body:
I arrived at A&E after seeing a private GP for right upper abdominal pain. Soon after I had my blood pressure taken.  
A couple of hours later I saw a doctor who took bloods and examined me. They said I would need to be reviewed by one of the surgical team doctors. They went off shift in the early evening. From then till almost midnight I sat unattended. I was given pain relief and had my blood pressure and temperature checked but no doctor saw me.  
While I appreciate the NHS is overwhelmed. A waiting time of 10 hours is just totally unacceptable. I sat in a chair as there were no beds available in absolute agony and in distress not knowing what was going on with me.  
I asked every hour on the hour what was going on and got told every hour someone was on the way. I am still here as I write this and no surgical doctor has been to see me.

readBy.name: Office of Foysol Choudhury, MSP for North Edinburgh, Leith, Edinburgh Western & West Lothian

title: Thank you so much for saving my life
body:
To ward 3 and A&E and to the CT scan unit. For detecting the blood clot. thank you so much for saving my life again. Your all super heros and thank you for getting my medication  delivered to my home. This fantastic hospital saved my life back on 19/02/1992.
You are very much appreciated and very much needed just remember that when things get tough.

author: Dazaposty
title: What a great team.
body: What a great team. They made me feel at ease from the moment I got there for my colonoscopy. I know they are all pushed to the limit at this time but nothing was to much trouble. All staff very informative and caring would like to thank them all.

author: hotelyd73
title: Lack of assessment
body:
I feel neglected. I am very sad feeling helpless. My son has been suffering all his life and recently he is thinking to end up his life. And yet I still get sent away home without any assessments on my son to get his diagnosis. How do I complain or get my son seriously looked at I don’t know.  
Single sad lost mother here.  
Thanks

readBy.name: South West London and St George's Mental Health NHS Trust

author: Loului
title: Confident and competent
body: I attended today for an implant removal and I felt like Nikki was confident, competent and she was invested in me. I felt safe at all times and my appointment was swift and seamless. I very much preferred this appointment compared to the previous experiences I have had with medical staff.

author: SamP
title: Minor injuries
body: I attended stobhill minor injury unit today, every single member of staff was approachable, knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. The department was very busy however every person I encountered from porters to nursing staff to the clerk were really nice, chatty and put me at ease, I wasn’t made to feel like I was wasting anyones time. The care I was given was done quickly yet I wasn’t made to feel like it was rushed and all information I was given was very helpful.

author: HeavyD
title: First class care in the stroke ward
body:
I'd like to highlight the absolutely 1st class care I received from the team in the stroke ward. In particular I'd like to highlight the genuine compassion and support given by both Joanne and Julie who looked after me on alternate shifts over my stay from Sunday until Tuesday.  
Much has been said about nursing staff over the last couple of years but I cannot speak highly enough of both these ladies and their commitment, humour and bedside manner were incredible. Overnight Julie endeavoured to complete her two hourly checks with the minimum of disruption and despite clearly being rushed off her feet was only too happy to stop, reassure and sometimes just chat to myself and others as if we were members of her friends or family rather than just patients.  
Joanne had the misfortune to deal with a crisis in the shape of one of her patients testing positive for covid and having to follow strict protocols to move all of us to other rooms, quickly but sensitively and professionally. During this time it would have been easy for her to take her eye off the ball, focus on the covid issue and forget about the levels of care for us impacted by the move. Not a bit of it, clearly a stressful situation she handled it with consummate professionalism, organising new beds and cleaning of new rooms while still ensuring that all our needs were met and questions answered.  
I don't know what these fantastic young ladies are paid but I can confirm that it's not enough. Crosshouse hospital and the NHS are lucky to have them.

title: Lovely and caring nurses
body: I've had two appointments with the nurses here and they have both been lovely and very reassuring. They gave me lots of information about everything they were doing and what my next steps would be, I felt very at ease.

author: blackbirdys94
title: Grateful for an exemplary programme.
body:
I attended a 12 session rehab course. To my surprise it didn't involve lung or chest exercises but was about strengthening big muscles and exercising to become slightly breathless.
Firstly I felt very cared for by the team who were really attentive and involved with each of us. They were lively and cheerful and made the sessions fun. Covid awareness was a priority too.
I also benefitted greatly from the education sessions at each meeting, I learnt a lot, some surprises, but everything geared to help us with our conditions and to improve our health and lung function .
The booklet backing everything up is excellent, and helps participants to continue exercising and progressing. There was also a tailored individual plan given .
I had a detailed post course review and was referred to a respiratory nurse. I felt that at last my concerns re my asthma/COPD were both being taken seriously and followed up on. 
All this is no small feat within the pandemic context, I am very grateful for an exemplary programme, which has helped me in a physical and educational sense. A big thank you to Claire, Gemma and all the team/specialists who contributed.

author: liongd47
title: The care was fantastic
body:
My implant was very deep, so i came to the clinic to have this removed.  
The doctor and nurse that were with me were absolutely brilliant. The doctor managed to get the implant out despite it being extremely deep. The care was fantastic.  
I was made to feel really at ease and everything was explained to me really well

author: chris4965
title: Thank you for the extra care
body: the staff on ward 5 was so lovely and caring when i was admitted onto this ward. charlene was very good she went out of her way to help me and helped me though a distressing time. i have disabilltes and was so scared having to stay 1 night on ward 5 but all the staff made sure they took care of me . on day of my small op on ward 5 charline stayed with me while they done it has i hated needles etc so the op was frightening for me. but i never forget the staff there they work really hard and would like to thank them all and also thank charline for the extra care she gave me during the distressful time.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor
body: Stood at the reception desk and was ignored, the phone ringing took precedence. I arrived at the surgery prior to the GP who was late for my appointment. This was for a blood pressure review where I had supplied weeks worth of readings in advance to the surgery. The GP stated they did not have the readings so we then conducted a pointless review. The GP, yet another I have never met before, was polite and engaging. I later spoke to the surgery to ask why the readings I had supplied were not on my file and I was told they were and were available to the GP to review. I can only conclude that what to me was an important review was not taken seriously by the GP and what they stated masked their disinterest in my case. I did ask the receptionist to make a complaint but was told there was no process to do that. I later had another review by phone with yet another GP who had reviewed my data. Poor experience where I most certainly did not feel loved by god as their mission statement promises.

author: AineMcMummy
title: We are blessed
body: I just want to share my thanks and admiration to the staff of wards 5 & 6 in Altnagelvin hospital, Derry. Northern Ireland. My child spent five days in the care of the wonderful people on these wards. From the consultants to cleaners, each & every person showed us fantastic care, attention and dedication. We are so grateful. Special thanks to Jennifer, Lorraine, Ann, Dr Rachel, Lionel, student nurse Olivia, and all the staff who took care of my young child. We are blessed to have such wonderful people working with our children.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Shambles
body: It is almost impossible to even get an appointment at this practice and then when you do the receptionists book you incorrectly so ends in a wasted trip. Manager however was lovely and tried to help however why are medical staff not checking why patients are attending these gold dust appointments - I called and booked an implant removal they booked me a coil removal I don’t have a coil… the nurse wasn’t able to remove it as it needs to be a GP how was this not picked up? were my medical records not looked at by the nurse? At least there’s a big difference between a coil and an implant if it had been a different small procedure would important details be noticed? I had to be the one to say to the nurse I don’t have a coil! Practice manager booked me an appointment for tomorrow again she was very helpful but I’ve definitely lost confidence in the surgery.

author: Aldie
title: Mental health service team
body:
I was referred to the DHH mental health team as I am in crisis since suffering the loss of 2 very close family members in a short space of time and quite quickly and I needed my meds etc sorted so my GP thought it would benefit me.  
The mental health practitioner came to see me and sat with their arms folded, didn’t read my file and I had to drag up my multiple traumas again.  
They said they would speak to the psychiatrist about my meds and refer me to CRUSE. They also weren't quite sure about medications  
2 weeks later and I had a further meeting and they had not done anything they were supposed to.  
A further 2 weeks and they were to speak to the psychiatrist again and was to contact me. So far no contact has been made.  
I was referred to this service as I was in genuine crisis and I had thoughts of taking my own life but couldn’t go through with it  
It’s 6-7 weeks now and I’m no further on…  
I am at my wits end and feel like no one believes me and my voice hasn’t been heard.  
My life is awful, I am existing, I need new meds to give me an incentive to leave the house, as I don’t leave house. This was the main reason I was referred to mental health team.  
I am at a loss and feel uncared for and feel like no one is taking me seriously  
Plus I haven’t slept for months now, which adds to my anxiety, I have explained this also but still nothing has been done after 7 weeks.  
As a health care professional myself I feel so let down and can’t see any other way to get help and get my life back  
I am desperate for help

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Thank you
body: I wanted to say thankyou to the nurse I saw this morning who was very calming and responsive to my nerves in doing what she could to help me feel comfortable for a blood test.

title: Zero tolerance
body: I don't think it's fair for a receptionist to ask a patient who has voiced suffers eith mental health and been told by her therapist to ring her doctors to get told there's no appointment heres others number then the receptionist has said if you can't speak to sumartins how can you speak to your doctors. Yes a patient I shouldn't have got verbal abuses but as a respectionist who works for the NHS to torment someone who has voiced they have mental health and suffer speaking to be people be told that. It called making a bond with your doctor due to trust issues the respectionist today was unprofessional and tormenting

author: Sally1986
title: Thank you for making an unpleasant procedure feel a lot more comfortable
body:
Today I attended clinic as I had a smear referral due to abnormal cells, the team at the clinic were super friendly and very helpful! I didn’t have a very long wait and was welcomed by all.  
Thank you for making such a unpleasant procedure feel a lot more comfortable.  
The results were also good news and no other treatment is needed!  
Thank you all x

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

author: Rose8
title: Coil removal and new one put in
body:
I had my coil taken out and a new one put in. 
I had the most relaxing and caring visit to the sexual health clinic. I had an uncomfortable removal due to my coil being not in the correct position, but both the doctors and the health worker made me feel so comfortable and at ease. Really really happy with my service

title: Outstanding
body: The care is outstanding in Rheumatology.  I was seen face to face and the relevant tests ordered. The tests revealed a serious condition for which I was referred to Neuro surgeons. Also referred to other specialty. I will still be under the care of the Rheumatologist , I have every faith that my care and treatment will continue to be outstanding. Thank you to all in this department.

readBy.name: Sarah Champion's Office, MP for Rotherham

author: C.Bramley
title: My son’s treatment
body: My son has had several outpatient appointments and surgery in the oral/maxfax outpatient department at the Royal Cornwall Hospital in Truro.  Every appointment went well, every step of his treatment explained. He had over a years gap between surgery & follow up but this could not be helped, his nhs dentist helped him. Today he was seen by Dr/Mr Nehush. Everything was explained thoroughly and due to his aspergers, he needs some time to make decisions about things. The Dr helped him to make a satisfactory decision so my son has no worries about future plans.

title: Great service
body: I called the surgery yesterday morning and got a call back from a doctor within the hour. After a telephone consultation he gave me a face to face appointment that afternoon. The doctor I saw said he would refer me to the hospital and the hospital called the very next morning offering me an appointment the next week. I am very impressed indeed with the seamless service I have received. Thank you.

author: Tomás
title: Everything explained in lay-person's terms
body: Wonderful treatment by everyone throughout a range of tests, treating me like a person at every point, from the person you meet at entry, to nursing assistants, to nurses, radiographers and specialist medics. Everything was fully explained in layperson's terms and I did not feel rushed at any point

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Elle51
title: Amazing staff
body: Thank you to Dr Davy and the staff in Clanrye Medical Practice and the staff in Daisy Hill A&E department, especially HCA Niamh and Dr Innocent who looked after our child with great care! They all put our child at ease and made him smile.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Thank you
body: My husband would like to pass on his thanks to the team, including the paramedics who treated him when he was admitted with a suspected TIA. Everyone involved was kind, helpful and made it feel less stressful particularly as his speech was affected which made every conversation much longer. Please pass on our thanks.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

author: bravort36
title: Inflexible podiatry service
body:
My mum is house bound with Alzheimer's and has carers in 4 times a day. She needs someone with her when her feet are done as she gets very upset. Both myself and my brother work.  
Getting a podiatry appointment for my mum in Bassetlaw is impossible. They phone the day before expecting you to be there when we are at work. They won’t come out on a Friday which is my day off, or after half 3 when I finish work. They won’t give a time when coming, just between 9:00 and 1:00. so I can’t even arrange for carers to be there. They won’t book an appointment in advance so I can get the day off work. It is totally impossible.  
I find them very rude on the phone and was even told once by the receptionist that my mum would have to pay privately.

title: Amazing
body: Referred to urology department two weeks ago and the speed and efficiency of the service was absolutely incredible. I cannot fault the radiology department and the minor ops team and the whole of the urology department. Such care,compassion and efficiency. Always had great service from this amazing hospital. Thank you so much for all you do.

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Amazing nurse
body: I was very anxious about the procedure but the nurse gave me all the necessary information and made me feel at ease.

author: sinki
title: Keep up the excellent work
body: the care i got from the team after i was discharged from hospital covid19 was excellent i had three different nurses look after me and i could not fault any one of them even after i was discharged from them they still took the time to phone to see how i was doing all i can say is keep up the excellent work you are doing

title: Absolutely wonderful experience
body: I arrived as an emergency. Everyone from porters, housekeeping to nurses, doctors, matrons, consultants, anaesthetists we’re all absolutely wonderful. I received fabulous care despite the covid restrictions. Thank you one and all for your professional and more than kind help.

author: Home21
title: Caring, understanding GP service
body: I wanted to praise the staff from reception to the doctors at my GP Gerafon surgery at Benllech. I and my husband have complex medical needs and our local GPs go above and beyond to help myself and my husband. They treated us with care and understanding.

links.id: she really took time with me

author: R Birch
title: Great experience
body: At the age of 78 I've seen many doctors, but Dr J Mukundan was by far the most attentive and compassionate and did not rush the consultation. My wife and I was most thankful for the way he explained everything and took time to do this.

title: Amazing Service
body:
Fantastic service from this surgery.
I suffered serious and deep cut to my hand while passing through St Ives with my work. With some urgency I required treatment to the wound and was treated with utmost care, professionalism, speed and consideration from all the staff I encountered. It was a slick and efficient service I received and I was treated with genuine care. The staff put me at ease and they were very friendly, just the sort of service and reassurance you need when you are hundreds of miles from home and I am truly very grateful.

author: Elits93
title: I felt totally overwhelmed
body: I had a heart attack and then diagnosed with type 1 diabetes. I then lost my dad who passed away 8 weeks after this. I felt totally overwhelmed.

author: omegahc33
title: Prep appointment and screening
body: Both the doctor and Juliet the nurse were great, taking care to explain things to me and to be gentle with me during blood tests and injections.

title: helpful team
body: following an econsult at the begining of the week i was prescribed some medication. However the pharmacy said it wasnt sent to them. I called the surgery and spoke to a lovely receptionist who was very helpful and got the prescription signed and sent to the chemist while I was on the phone with her!

title: Wonderful staff
body: Nobody wants an injury but if you are unlucky enough to have an accident, there's no place better to take yourself than this hospital's Minor Injuries Unit. The staff are all extremely sympathetic and they run a very efficient operation. I visited after a fall and having had three consultations and a number of X-rays I left within an hour. A wonderful place!

author: Bats
title: Amazed at the effort of all the staff
body:
I was admitted to Crosshouse Hospital CAU where I ended up having a CT scan, MRI, lumber puncture and being assessed by the QEUH neurologist. I also spent one night in ward 3E. I was in from Monday afternoon until Friday afternoon where it was repeatedly thought I had a bleed in my brain (at one point also a shadow and an infection). I am a mother to a young family and this came out of what I thought was routine and quick GP appointment.  
I was amazed at the effort that all of the staff were making despite clear pressures. Their commitment to ascertaining what was wrong with me and unwillingness to take any risks or leave any stone unturned was fantastic. Everyone was incredibly kind including the doctors, registrar, consultant (who was able to tell me my own story back after four days in hospital), porters, nurses and auxiliary staff were excellent.  
In particular Rachel (doctor CAU) who tried to do my lumber puncture repeatedly despite my fainting and was constantly reassuring. She brought in support when required but stayed with me. Rachel checked on me personally at the very beginning of her shift the next day which I appreciated more than anything.  
Joanne who was the nurse in 3E and went out of her way to check up one me (and get me ‘the good shower’ which was so appreciated) and always checked on all of her patients before taking her breaks. What a presence she has in the ward.  
Dr Ghosh (sp), the consultant who was so reassuringly able to tell me my whole four day story back to me without me saying anything. The reassurance of knowing the consultant I was speaking to at my near-discharge knew my whole story was fantastic. It saved me repeating the story and made me feel I had consistent care throughout.  
George - one of my many porters - kept my spirits up and wouldn’t have me walk an inch. One of many and I am sorry I can’t remember the names of the others.

readBy.name: Office of Ruth Maguire ( Mp for Cunninghame South )

title: Excellent service
body: I had knee replacement surgery, and was very happy with the treatment I recieved from everyone involved. The accommodation was lovely, and the food was really good, should I need further treatment in this area I would definitely choose to return to this hospital.

title: Delightful efficient kind & compassionate doctor
body: I needed urgent advice regarding my persistent hypertension and my doctor listened and advised me accordingly. She again made this practice stand out high and proud within the NHS Organisation. I feel very lucky to be a patient of this practice. Eternally Grateful. Thank you!

title: Rolls-Royce service
body: Today we had blood samples taken and an injection. The nurses were professional, caring and kind… not many people can describe these procedures as a pleasure, but we enjoyed the whole visit!

title: Rolls-Royce service
body: Today we had blood samples taken and an injection. The nurses were professional, caring and kind… not many people can describe these procedures as a pleasure, but we enjoyed the whole visit!

title: Great Staff
body:
Recently I visited children's ward and the care was great for me as a 12 y old it was so good all the staff were great doctors& Nursers& Consultants and the care was amazing all the staff were friendly the hospital is a great hospital and the staff are just amazing last year I visited children's ward and it was good then both sets of staff day and night were amazing and the care at the A&E Children's department was amazing in triage and the doctor that I saw was amazing.
Thank you Ormskirk Hospital You are amazing.

title: Superb practice
body: During lockdown, this practrice was one of the few in Burnley and Pendle, which saw patients face to face, had telephone consultations, continued with regular blood tests, returned calls, and had receptionists who were pleasant, kind and efficient at passing patients on to be triaged. Parkside is a first class example of what a GP practice should be.

title: Absolute fantastic surgery and staff
body: I cannot thank all the staff enough at practice when I was seriously ill last year they looked after me as well as Salford Royal Hospital fantastic service at Chapel medical centre and fantastic staff and Doctors thankyou so much looking after my health.

title: Great service
body: My little boy received wonderful care after falling and hurting his head, all the staff were lovely.

readBy.name: Dorset HealthCare University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Doctor has supported very much
body: My daughter was very sick and prospect surgery GP  Doctor has helped in getting fast appointment and suggested medicine on time . Very happy with the service

title: A breath of fresh air
body: Transferred our family to this surgery and from registration to first appointment I have been really impressed. We had an extremely poor experience with our previous GP and this is a real breath of fresh air - how primary care should be! Attentive and thorough appointment. Thank you.

author: Isagq84
title: Staff making unfounded assumptions
body:
Our child developed severe incessant vomiting and diarrhoea in early March 2022, hence we rushed to the Royal Belfast Hospital for Sick Children at around 18:45 hrs. I am severely hearing impaired, and cannot hear through face masks.  
Hence I wrote down a timeline and description of our child's symptoms to give to the medical personnel. I also wrote on the top of the sheet that I had prepared it as I am hearing impaired. I repeated this to the triage nurse verbally while handing over the paper. They barely glanced at it or heard me, and asked if I spoke English. I said it is my first language. They laughed and asked if it was just the accent then? I advised them that I was deaf.  
They said, with a wink, that they saw in the waiting room that "someone" was sitting on the chair whilst I was on the floor with the baby, and that next time I should tell "someone" to sit on the floor and to let me sit on the chair.  
I believe they meant my husband. The waiting room was only half full and there were plenty of empty chairs. I was sitting on the floor as it was approximately 8:00 pm and past the child's bedtime, and child wanted to lie down on my lap, as they were also completely exhausted from the vomiting and diarrhoea. The waiting area chairs are quite narrow and you cannot sit comfortably cross legged on them holding a primary school aged child across your lap. I think they made the assumption that as we are Asian, my husband was being a chauvinist and not permitting his wife to sit on a chair. It's ridiculous. I told them straight away why I was sitting on the floor, and that my husband is not a patriarchal person (I'd be the the first to call him out if that were the case).  
It took us six hours to see a doctor. In my view, instead of wasting time trying to find oppressed women where there are none, it might be better if the staff directed their energies to provide proper healthcare.  
**Video of story in BSL **  
This is a translation by a BSL translator  
[https://vimeo.com/838200524](https://vimeo.com/838200524)  
**Video of story in ISL**  
This is a translation by an ISL translator  
[https://vimeo.com/839982937](https://vimeo.com/839982937)

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Chl1701
title: What a fantastic team!
body:
I recently was admitted through Day Surgery at Crosshouse Hospital, Kilmarnock for a hysterectomy.  
I just wanted to say how amazing all the staff were that were involved in my care. From Day Surgery, theatres, recovery, gynaecology ward staff ( special shout out to the night shift nurses) and of course Dr Sokolova. The whole process was faultless and as a nurse myself it was lovely to have a positive experience. What a fantastic team!  
Thank you

title: Excellent practice
body: Each person that I have encountered at both the Stalham and Ludham branches have been so kind and supportive to me. I am currently dealing with the aftermath of a serious operation and I really feel that I am in good hands. Thank you to the whole team.

author: A delighted patient
title: The whole experience was amazing
body:
I had an online consultation with my local GP at Beechtree surgery, Selby less than an hour after phoning the them about my increasing difficulty with breathing during any activity, even just getting dressed. After our discussion my GP referred me to SDEC to investigate the possibility of blood clots or lung cancer and contacted them to expect me.  
My wife drove me to hospital and I arrived at about 1.30pm. I was seen immediately a nurse (Zoe) and was examined by a doctor (Sarah Carlton). They were able to access my records online as I had moved here from Sheffield 18 months ago.  
Within 7 hours I was thoroughly examined, had an X-ray, ECG and CT scan. Their opinion was that I was suffering from COPD. I was then discharged with a comprehensive report on my treatment and recommendations for further treatment.  
The whole experience was amazing, everyone I saw was so attentive and kind. To have been given so much attention and investigation in such a short time and to leave with a comprehensive report of treatment and recommendations within less than half a day is, in my opinion, quite amazing and I cannot praise everyone who saw me to highly. My heartfelt thanks to everyone concerned.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: andromedaqs38
title: "Suicidal"
body:
Hello,  
for anyone reading this, i hope that it will be of some help to you.  
I won't to go into all the details, but who ever you are, and for whatever your reasons for finding yourself reading this i want you to know that there probably is not much more going through your mind right now that's much different than what had gone through mine!!  
Therapy is not for me, it's for other people. It's something we know about, and tgat's good for them. I'm different though, i can sort things out for myself thanks. I'm strong and not weak!!  
Well that's how i roll , or at least that is still how i see myself.  
I just wanted to give the feedback on here as i have in the last week completed the 'therapy' sessions so at least i can give you (anyone) like me, my honest opinion on getting in touch with Inclusion Thurrock.  
The past three years of my life got harder,darker and basically pointless.  
Grief, Depression, Vile Employer, Better off dead!  
They were all my ingredients that led to my signing up to the "Inclusion Thurrock" therapy service.  
CJ was my therapist, from the very offset , and i mean from the very first opening of the telephone conversation it was like talking eith a good friend.  
I outlined basically what i thought it was going to be like doing this , and what i expected to get out of it all at the end of it.  
That was basically that i thought the therapist cannot fix it, that there is no magic band aid that can be applied and once taken off - you're all healed.  
But, what i was willing to do , was to give it a try..  
Throughout those weeks CJ was fantastic, she did not judge and she did not lead me anywhere that i didn't want to go.  
What she did do was "Listen" and "Understand"  
There was no pressure, and i had no dread in waiting for her call each week. Albeit i did not use this system as a comfort blanket, or indeed latch onto my therapist for longer and importantly for any longer than i needed as an individual.  
But, and this is the important part of why ive done this.  
Before you out there do anything that you might be facing or planning to do..  
Get in touch with "Inclusion Thurrock" and at least try this. It really helps!  
My thanks to everyone at inclusion and my utmost thanks to CJ !
